author: Ground News
title: Ground News - ‘One of the best in Pakistan’: Odd claim as Aussies hope fielding blunders save tight Test
text:
Summary by Ground News Abdullah Shafique put down a second crucial catch in the slips cordon on the third day at the MCG. The 24-year-old dropped David Warner early in Australia's first innings before the opener went on to put on 90 runs with Usman Khawaja. Former Australian star fielder Mark Waugh called for him to be removed from the slips. Pakistan 's Mir Hamza insisted his place was in the cordon. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Fox Sports Australia Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Murdoch Family Media Conglomerate: Telstra ‘One of the best in Pakistan’: Odd claim as Aussies hope fielding blunders save tight Test Abdullah Shafique’s teammate has leapt to his defence after the gun opener put down a second crucial catch in the slips cordon on the third day at the MCG. Day 4 live from 10am AEDT!
